com.naef.jnlua

Interface Converter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultConverter

    public interface Converter
    Converts between Lua values and Java objects.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void convertJavaObject(LuaState luaState, Object object)
      Converts a Java object to a Lua value and pushes that value on the stack.
      <T> T convertLuaValue(LuaState luaState, int index, Class<T> formalType)
      Converts a Lua value to a Java object of the specified formal type.
      int getTypeDistance(LuaState luaState, int index, Class<?> formalType)
      Returns the type distance between a Lua value and a formal Java type.

    • Method Detail

      • getTypeDistance

        int getTypeDistance(LuaState luaState,
                  int index,
                  Class<?> formalType)
        Returns the type distance between a Lua value and a formal Java type. Distances are comparable for the same Lua value only. If a Lua value cannot be converted to the specified formal type, the method returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        luaState - the Lua state
        index - the stack index containing the value
        formalType - the formal Java type
        Returns:
        the type distance, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if the conversion is not supported

      • convertLuaValue

        <T> T convertLuaValue(LuaState luaState,
                    int index,
                    Class<T> formalType)
        Converts a Lua value to a Java object of the specified formal type.

        If the Lua value is nil, the method returns null.

        Parameters:
        luaState - the Lua state
        index - the stack index containing the value
        formalType - the formal Java type
        Returns:
        the Java object, or null
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the conversion is not possible

      • convertJavaObject

        void convertJavaObject(LuaState luaState,
                     Object object)
        Converts a Java object to a Lua value and pushes that value on the stack.

        If the object is null, the method pushes nil.

        Parameters:
        luaState - the Lua state
        object - the Java object, or null
